intro: Amyema miraculosa subsp. boormanii, commonly known as the Boorman's ghost gum, is a rare and unique species native to the arid regions of Western Australia. It is characterized by its distinctive silver-blue foliage and a trunk that often appears to be dead or decayed, giving it its common name. The plant has small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom in late winter or early spring. It is adapted to extreme drought conditions and thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a vulnerable species.
